column5: Here is the other one I got up at Kesagami Lake Lodge.  It shows the action of the Johnson Silver Minnow that a lot of the northern Lodges recommend... and I can see why now.. It's tipped with a small plastic minnow.  I know I'm going to be using that setup a bit more!!  CLICK HERE TO VIEW
VERY COOL!!!  These videos are getting me so pumped up for my trip up there.  Well one of there outpost camps, Floodwood Lake.  Only 2 more sleeps!  Thanks for sharing TJ!
Chomp!!! pt. 2  I think you need to sharpen those hooks though TJ, that's 0 for 2  Tony
Nice.  First time I realized how sexy a JSM can be.  Nice movement.  How do you fasten the fishing line to your camera cable?  Does it break away when a fish hits?
TG... lol..  Id tell but id have ta....  and I fish with all barbless hooks... the intent it to get the hit... not so much the fish on....
Just when you think you've heard every excuse for loosing a fish.....

TJ, I was thinking about fastening my line to the camera cable with a small rubber band that would break loose when a fish hits the lure.  How's that sound?  First I need to find some clear water to fish.
I was thinking about how to do it too I thought the downrigger release clips would do the best job I will have to play and see what I can make work
